title: Public transport for the A-League Round 29 – Melbourne Victory v Newcastle Jets
articleContent:
Join Melbourne Victory for the final game of the home and away season as they take on the Newcastle Jets at AAMI Park. Public transport is your best way to enjoy the action.

We're running extra services to help you get home from AAMI Park on Sunday 4 May.

Kick-off is at 5pm.

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Please note the following works which may impact your journey:

  • Passengers on the Werribee line, please note, buses replace trains between Newport and Werribee from 9pm.
  • Passengers on the Frankston line, please board a Pakenham service at Richmond, and transfer at Caulfield for a connecting train.

 Metropolitan train

Travelling from Richmond Station

Additional trains run on the following lines after the game:

  • Ringwood - leaving at 7:13pm from Platform 9
  • Glen Waverley – leaving at 7:08pm from Platform 10
  • East Pakenham– leaving at 7:07pm from Platform 6
  • Sandringham – leaving at 7:14pm from Platform 2

 Metropolitan tram

Getting to and from AAMI Park

Extra Route 70 trams run between Flinders Street / Elizabeth Street (Stop 4) and Stop 7C MCG/John Cain Arena before and after the game. 

 Metropolitan bus

Catch a Route 246 bus close to AAMI Park.

The last bus may depart before the game finishes.

 Regional train

  • Normal trains leave from Southern Cross Station
